description: Christopher Columbus was born in Genoa, Italy in 1451. He grew up in this bustling port city and likely began his seafaring career here.
Columbus settled in Portugal around 1476. He worked as a mapmaker and gained knowledge and experience in navigation during his time here.
Columbus began his historic first voyage from Palos de la Frontera, Spain, in 1492, setting sail to find a new route to Asia.
Christopher Columbus passed away in Valladolid, Spain in 1506 at the age of 55. He was buried here before his remains were later moved to Seville.
After his death, Columbus was buried in Seville, Spain, at the Catedral de Sevilla. His remains were later moved to the Faro a Colón in the Dominican Republic.
Christopher Columbus' remains were later interred at the Faro a Colón in Santo Domingo Este, Dominican Republic, as per his wishes.
